title: Build a Poncho Lean-To Shelter
brief: Construct a quick, effective lean-to shelter using a poncho, rope, and stakes for protection from wind and rain.
steps: Step 1: Check wind direction and position the shelter so the back faces into the wind.
Step 2: Tie off the poncho hood by pulling drawstring tight, rolling it lengthwise, folding in thirds, and tying off.
Step 3: Cut rope in half (1-1.5 meters each). Tie each half to corner grommets on one long side of poncho.
Step 4: Attach 10-centimeter drip sticks to each rope, 2.5 centimeters from the grommets to prevent water running down ropes.
Step 5: Tie ropes to trees at waist height using round turn and two half hitches with quick-release knot, 2-3 meters apart.
Step 6: Spread poncho and anchor to ground by pushing sharpened 30-centimeter stakes through grommets.
Step 7: Place insulating material (leaves, pine needles) inside the lean-to to reduce heat loss to ground.
warnings: You lose up to 80% of body heat to the ground when at rest - insulation underneath is critical.
Ensure drip sticks are properly positioned or rainwater will run into your shelter.
Make sure the back of the lean-to faces into the wind direction.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army (Chapter 5 - Shelters)
